description:
1. If two trains of length a m and b m are travelling in opposite directions with speeds of x m/s and y m/s,
Relative Speed = (x+y) m/s
Time taken to cross each other = (a+b)/(x+y) seconds

2. If two trains of length a m and b m are travelling in the same direction with speeds of x m/s and y m/s (x>y),
Relative Speed = (x-y) m/s
Time taken to cross each other = (a+b)/(x-y) seconds

3. If two trains P and Q start at the same time from stations A and B towards each other and after crossing each other, they take x seconds and y seconds to reach B and A respectively,
P's speed:Q's speed = √y:√x

4. Time taken by a train of length l m travelling at a speed of x m/s to cross a pole or a standing post is
l/x seconds

5. Time taken by a train of length l m travelling at a speed of x m/s to cross a stationary object of length a metres is
(l+a)/x seconds

options.detail:
Let the distance between A and B be x km

Time taken by train P = x/100

Time taken by train Q = x/120

x/100 = (x/120) + (1/4)
x = 150km

questions.text: Two trains P and Q are traveling from station A to station B at speeds of 100kmph and 120 kmph respectively. Train Q stops at station C for 10 minutes but reaches station B 5 minutes before train P. Find the distance between stations A and B.

options.detail:
Let the distance between C and D be x km

Time taken by train A = x/80

Time taken by train B = x/120

x/80 = (x/120) + (1/2)
x = 120km

questions.text: Two trains A and B travel at speeds of 80kmph and 120kmph respectively, from station C to D. If train B reaches half an hour before train A, find the distance between stations C and D.

options.detail:
Relative speed of the trains 
= 150-120 
= 30 kmph 
= 30*5/18 m/s
30*5/18 = l/60
l = 500m

questions.text: A passenger in a train travelling at 150 kmph observes another train travelling in the same direction at a speed of 120 kmph for 1 minute. Find the length of the second train.

options.detail:
Relative speed of the trains 
= 110+90 
= 200 kmph 
= 200*5/18 m/s
200*5/18 = (225+l)/9
l = 275m

questions.text: Two trains travelling in opposite directions at speeds of 110 kmph and 90 kmph cross each other for 9s. If the length of the first train is 225m, find the length of the second train.

options.detail:
Let the speeds of the two trains be x miles/hr and (x-6) miles/hr.

Combined distance travelled by the two trains from 10 am to 1:30 pm = 287 miles

(3.5*x)+(3.5*(x-6))=287
x=44 miles/hr

questions.text: At 10 a.m. two trains started traveling toward each other from stations 287 miles apart. They passed each other at 1:30 p.m. the same day. If the average speed of the faster train exceeded the average speed of the slower train by 6 miles per hour, which of the following represents the speed ofthe faster train, in miles per hour?

options.detail:
Speed of the train 
= 54 km/hr 
= 54*5/18 = 15 m/s
Length of the train 
= 15*20 = 300m
300+l = 36*15 
l = 240m

questions.text: A train passes a station platform in 36 seconds and a man standing on the platform in 20 seconds. If the speed of the train is 54 km/hr, what is the length of the platform?

options.detail:
Let the speeds of the trains be x m/s and y m/s respectively.
l1 = 12xl2 = 10y
Second train overtakes the first train. So y>x

l1+l2 = 54(y-x)
12x+10y = 54(y-x)

66x = 44y
x:y=2:3

questions.text: Two trains travelling in the same direction cross a pole in 12 seconds and 10 seconds respectively. The second train takes 54 seconds to cross the first train. Find the ratio of their speed.

options.detail:
Let the speeds of the trains be x m/s and y m/s respectively.

x:y = √32:√50 = 4:5

questions.text: Two trains start at the same time, one from station A to B and another from station B to A. After they meet, they take 50 seconds and 32 seconds to reach their destinations respectively. Find the ratio of their speeds.
A train of length 260 m crosses a bridge of length 40 m in 12 seconds. Find the speed of the train.

options.detail:
Relative speed 
= 40-10 = 30 kmph
Time taken to cross the man 
= (100+200)/30 = 10s

questions.text: A man jogs at a speed of 10 kmph along a railway track. A train of length 100 m running in the same direction at a speed of 40 kmph is 200 m behind him. Find the time taken by the train to cross the man.

options.detail:
Relative speed of the trains 
= 48+60 
= 108 kmph 
= 30 m/s
Length of the second train
=30*8 = 240m

(l+240) = 30*17 = 510

l = 270m

questions.text: A passenger in a train of length l running at a speed of 48 kmph observes another train running in the opposite direction at a speed of 60 kmph for 8 seconds. The trains cross each other for 17 seconds. Find l.

options.detail:
Distance travelled by C in ½ an hour (at 4:30 pm) 
= 40* ½ = 20 km
Let the distance travelled by C after 4:30 pm till it meets D be x km. 

Time taken by C to travel x km = Time taken by D to travel 90-x km

x/40 = (90-x)/50
x=40 km

Time taken = 1 hour
They meet at 5:30 pm(an hour after 4:30 pm).

questions.text: Stations A and B are 110 km apart. Train C starts from A at 4:00 pm and travels to B at a speed of 40 kmph. Train D starts from B at 4:30 pm and travels towards A at a speed of 50 kmph. They meet at

options.detail:
Speed of the train = 220/11 = 20 m/s

Let the length of the platform be l m

(220+l)/20 = 20
l = 180m

questions.text: A train 220 m long crosses a man standing in a platform in 11 seconds and the platform in 20 seconds. Find the length of the platform.

options.detail:
Speed of the train 
= 90*5/18 = 25 m/s
Time to cross the tunnel 
= (1000+200)/25 = 48s

questions.text: Find the time taken by a train of length 200 m travelling at a speed of 90 kmph to cross a 1 km long tunnel.

options.detail:
Relative speed 
= 50+40 
= 90 kmph 
= 25 m/s
If the length of the first train is l m, the length of the second train is 2l m.

3l/25 = 12
l  = 100m

questions.text: A train travelling at 50 kmph crosses another train which is twice its length and travelling in the opposite direction at a speed of 40 kmph in 12 seconds. Find the length of the first train.

options.detail:
Relative Speed
= 150-90
= 60 kmph
= (60*5/18) m/s
Distance covered in 18 seconds
= (60*5/18)*18
= 300m
l1+l2 = 300
l2 = 100m

questions.text: A train 200m long travelling at a speed of 150 kmph overtakes another train travelling at a speed of 90 kmph in 18 seconds. Find the length of the second train.

options.detail:
Ratio of their speeds is inversely proportional to the ratio of the time taken since the distance travelled(length of the trains) is equal.

Ratio of their speeds
= 18:12
= 3:2

questions.text: Two trains of equal length take 12 seconds and 18 seconds respectively to cross a telegraph post. Find the ratio of their speeds.

options.detail:
Let the length of the train be l1 km and the length of the platform be l2 km.

Speed = 72kmph = 20m/s

(l1+l2)/20 = 20
l1/20 = 9

Solving,
l2 = 220m

questions.text: A train travelling at 72 kmph crosses a platform in 20 seconds and a man standing on the platform in 9 seconds. What is the length of the platform?

options.detail:
Let d1 and d2 be the distances travelled by the two trains when they meet.

Let their speeds be x kmph and (x+10) kmph.

d1+d2=180

2x+2*(x+10) = 180

Solving,
x=40
Speed of the faster train 
= 50kmph

questions.text: A and B are two stations located 180 kilometres apart. Two trains start from the two stations at the same time and meet each other after two hours. If the speed of the train moving from A to B is 10 kmph more than the train moving in the opposite direction, find the speed of the faster train.

options.detail:
First train:
Speed = 90kmph = 25m/s
Length = l1m
Second train:
Speed = 72kmph = 20 m/s
Length = l2m
(l1+200)/25 = 16
(l2+200)/20 = 22

l1=200m
l2=240m

l1:l2=5:6

questions.text: Two trains travelling at speeds of 90kmph and 72kmph take 16 seconds and 22 seconds to cross a platform of length 200m. Find the ratio of their lengths.

options.detail:
Let the speed of the train be x km/hr.

Relative speed of the train and the first person
= x-3 kmph
= (x-3)*(5/18) m/s
Relative speed of the train and the second person
= (x-5)*(5/18) m/s
Length of the train
= Relative speed*Time to overtake

[(x-3)*(5/18)]*14 = [(x-5)*(5/18)]*14.4

(x-3)*14 = (x-5)*14.4
Solving,
14x-42 = 14.4x-72
0.4x = 30
x = 75kmph

questions.text: A train overtakes two persons walking at speeds of 3 kmph and 5 kmph in 14 seconds and 14.4 seconds respectively. If they are walking in the same direction as the train, find the speed of the train.

options.detail:
Speed of the train
= 54*5/18
= 15 m/s
Time taken
= 300/15
= 20 seconds

questions.text: The time taken by a 300m long train travelling at a speed of 54 kmph to cross a pole is

options.detail:
Let the lengths of the two trains be l1 m and l2 m respectively.

l2=2*l1

Speed of the second train
= 72/2
= 36 kmph
Relative speed of the two trains
= 72-36
= 36 kmph
= 10 m/s
Time taken to cross each other
(l1+l2)/10 = 45
3l1 = 450
l1 = 150 m

questions.text: A train travelling at 72 kmph overtakes another train twice its length travelling in the same direction with half its speed in 45 seconds. Find the length of the first train.

options.detail:
Let the length of the platform be x m.

300/20 = (300+x)/100

15 = (300+x)/100

1500 = 300+x

x = 1200m = 1.2 km

questions.text: A train crosses a man standing on a platform in 20 seconds and the platform in 100 seconds. If the train is 300m long, find the length of the platform.

options.detail:
Time taken
= 1 hour 20 minutes
= 1+(20/60)
= 1(1/3) hours
= 4/3 hours
Speed
= 60:(4/3)
= 45 kmph

questions.text: A train starts from station A at 7:00 a.m. and reaches station B at 8:20 a.m. Find the speed of the train if the distance between the stations A and B is 60 km.

options.detail:
Let the distance between the A and B be x km and 
      the usual time of travel be y hours

If speed=50 kmph,
time taken = y+5 mins
(x/50) = y-(5/60)
If speed=40 kmph,
time taken = y+5 mins
(x/48) = y+(5/60)

Solving the two equations,
x=200 km

questions.text: If a train travels from station A to B at an average speed of 50 kmph without any stoppages, it reaches 5 minutes before the scheduled time. However, if it travels at an average speed of 48 kmph, it reaches 5 mins late. Find the distance between A and B.

options.detail:
Relative speed of the trains
= (240+210)/18
= 450/18
= 25 m/s
= (25*18/5) kmph
= 90 kmph
40+x=90
x=50 kmph

questions.text: Two trains of length 240 m and 180 m, travelling in opposite directions cross each other in 45 seconds. If the speed of the first train is 40 kmph, find the speed of the second train.

options.detail:
Distance travelled by the train in 2 minutes
= (45*5/18)*60
= 750 m
Length of the bridge
= 750-200
= 550 m

questions.text: A train travelling at a speed of 45 kmph takes 2 minutes to cross a bridge. If the train is 200m long, find the length of the bridge.

options.detail:
Let the speeds of train A be 3x kmph and 4x kmph.

Distance travelled by train A in the first 1 hour(9 am to 10 am)
= 3x km
Relative speed of trains moving in the same direction
= 4x-3x
= x kmph
Train A is 3x km ahead of B at 10 am.

Time taken to cover 3x km with a relative speed of x kmph
= 3x/x
= 3 hours
Train B crosses train A at 1 pm.

questions.text: Trains A and B start from station P in the same direction at 9:00 am and 10:00 am respectively. If the speeds of the trains are in the ratio 3:4, at what time will train B cross train A?

options.detail:
Distance travelled by train A in 25 minutes
= 60*25/60
= 25 km
Distance travelled by train B in 25 minutes
= 48*25/60
= 20 km
Distance between them
= 45 km

questions.text: Two trains, with speeds of 60 kmph and 48 kmph, leave the same station at the same time in opposite directions. How far apart will they be after 25 minutes?

options.detail:
Speed of the train
= 54*5/18 m/s
= 15 m/s

The man is walking in the same direction as that of the train.
Speed of the man
= 6*5/18
= 5/3 m/s
Relative speed
= 15-(5/3)
= 40/3 m/s
Length of the train
= 12*40/3
= 160 m

Let the length of the platform be x m.

l+x = 15*20 = 300

x=140m

questions.text: A train running at 54 kmph takes 20 seconds to pass a platform. Next it takes 12 seconds to pass a man walking at 6 kmph in the same direction in which the train is going. Find the length of the platform.

options.detail: Let the speed in return journey be x km/hr.Then, speed in onward journey =(125/100)x = (5/4)x km/hrSo. Speed in onward journey = [(5/4)*45] km/hr = 56.25 km/hr

questions.text: The average speed of a train in the onward journey is 25% more than that in the return journey. The train halts for one hour on reaching the destination. The total time taken for the complete to and from journey is 17 hours, covering a distance of 800 km. The speed of the train in the onward journey is:

options.detail: Ratio of speeds = 4 : 3 : 5Therefore Ratio of times taken = (1/4) : (1/3) : (1/5) = 15 : 20 : 12

questions.text: Three trains are travelling from a place A to another place B. Their speeds are in the ratio of 4 : 3 : 5. The time ratio to reach B by these trains will be in the ratio

options.detail: Suppose they meet x hours after 14.30 hrs. Then, 60x = 80 (x - 2) or x = 8.Required distance = (60 x 8) km = 480 km.

questions.text: Bombay Express Left Delhi from Bombay at 14.30 hrs, travelling at a speed of 60 kmph and Rajdhani Express left. Delhi for Bombay on thesame day at 16.30 hrs, travelling at a speed of 80 kmph. How far away from Delhi will the two trains meet?

options.detail:
Let the initial speed of the train be x kmph.

7x = 5(x+12)

2x = 60

x = 30

Total distance travelled
= 2*7x
= 420 km

questions.text: A train travels a certain distance taking 7 hrs in forward journey. During the return journey, the speed is increased by 12 km/hr and the time taken is 5 hrs. What is the total distance travelled?

options.detail:
Let the speed of the second train be x kmph.

(50+x)*5/18 = (108+112)/6

50+x = 132

x = 82 m

questions.text: A train 108 m long moving at a speed of 50 km/hr crosses a train 112 m long coming from opposite direction in 6 seconds. The speed of the second train is
A train 800 metres long is running at a speed of 78 km/hr. If it crosses a tunnel in 1 minute, then the length of the tunnel (in meters) is
A train 360 m long is running at a speed of 45 km/hr. In what time will it pass a bridge 140 m long?

options.detail:
Let the length of the train be l m and
the speed of the train be x kmph.

8.4*(x-4.5)*5/18 = 8.5*(x-5.4)*5/18

0.1x = 8.1

x = 81 kmph

questions.text: A train overtakes two persons walking along a railway track. The first one walks at 4.5 km/hr. The other one walks at 5.4 km/hr. The train needs 8.4 and 8.5 seconds respectively to overtake them. What is the speed of the train if both the persons are walking in the same direction as the train?

options.detail:
Speed of the train
= 300/18

Let the length of the bridge be x m.

(300+x) = (300/18)*39

x = 350

questions.text: A 300 metre long train crosses a platform in 39 seconds while it crosses a signal pole in 18 seconds. What is the length of the platform?

options.detail:
Ratio of their speeds
= √16:√9
= 4:3

questions.text: Two, trains, one from Howrah to Patna and the other from Patna to Howrah, start simultaneously. After they meet, the trains reach their destinations after 9 hours and 16 hours respectively. The ratio of their speeds is

options.detail:
Relative Speed
= 66 kmph

Time taken
= 110/(66*5/18)
= 6 seconds

questions.text: A train 110 metres long is running with a speed of 60 kmph. In what time will it pass a man who is running at 6 kmph in the direction opposite to that in which the train is going?

options.detail:
Speed of the train
= 240/24
= 10 m/s
Time taken to cross the pole
= (240+650)/10
= 89

questions.text: A train 240 m long passes a pole in 24 seconds. How long will it take to pass a platform 650 m long?
A goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 26 seconds. What is the length of the goods train?

A train travelling at 48 kmph completely crosses another train having half its length and travelling in opposite direction at 42 kmph, in 12 seconds. It also passes a railway platform in 45 seconds. The length of the platform is

options.detail:
Relative speed
= 45-9
= 36 kmph
Time taken
= (240+120)/(36*5/18)
= 36 seconds

questions.text: A jogger running at 9 kmph alongside a railway track is 240 m ahead of the engine of a 120 m long train running at 45 kmph in the same direction. In how much time, will the train pass the jogger?

options.detail:
Relative Speed
= 40-20
= 20 kmph

l = 5*20*5/18 = 27.77 m

questions.text: Two trains are running at 40 km/hr and 20 km/hr respectively in the same direction. Fast train completely passes a man sitting in the slower train in 5 seconds. What is the length of the fast train?

options.detail:
Relative Speed
= 120+80
= 200 kmph

270+l = 9*200*5/18

l = 230 m

questions.text: A 270 metres long train running at the speed of 120 kmph crosses another train running in opposite direction at the speed of 80 kmph in 9 seconds. What is the length of the other train?

options.detail:
Let the speeds of the two trains be x1 m/s and x2 m/s
and their lengths be l1 m and l2 m.

l1 = 27*x1
l2 = 17*x2

(l1+l2) = 23*(x1+x2)
27x1 + 17x2 = 23x1 + 23x2

4x1 = 6x2

x1:x2 = 3:2

questions.text: Two trains running in opposite directions cross a man standing on the platform in 27 seconds and 17 seconds respectively and they cross each other in 23 seconds. The ratio of their speeds is

options.detail:
Let the speeds of the two trains be x1 m/s and x2 m/s.

x1 = 120/10 = 12 m/s
x2 = 120/15 = 8 m/s

Relative speed
= 20 m/s

Time taken to cross each other
= 240/20
= 12 s

questions.text: Two trains of equal lengths take 10 seconds and 15 seconds respectively to cross a telegraph post. If the length of each train be 120 metres, in what time (in seconds) will they cross each other travelling in opposite direction?

options.detail:
Let the speed of the train be s kmph and its length be l m.

l = 9*(s-2)*5/18 = 10*(s-4)*5/18

9s - 18 = 10s - 40

s = 22

l = 9*20*5/18 = 50 m

questions.text: A train overtakes two persons who are walking in the same direction in which the train is going, at the rate of 2 kmph and 4 kmph and passes them completely in 9 and 10 seconds respectively. The length of the train is
A train 125 m long passes a man, running at 5 km/hr in the same direction in which the train is going, in 10 seconds. The speed of the train is

options.detail:
Distance travelled by the first train in an hour (at 8:00 am) 
= 20*1 = 20 km

They are 90 km apart at 8 am.

Let the distance travelled by the first train after 8:00 am till it meets the second train be x km. 

Time taken by Train 1 to travel x km = Time taken by Train 2 to travel 90-x km

x/20 = (90-x)/25
x=40 km

Time taken by the first train to travel 40 km = 2 hours

They meet at 10:00 am(2 hours after 8 am).

questions.text: Two stations A and B are 110 km apart on a straight line. One train starts from A at 7 a.m. and travels towards B at 20 kmph. Another train starts from B at 8 a.m. and travels towards A at a speed of 25 kmph. At what time will they meet?

options.detail:
Time taken
= (3.5+0.25)/75 hours
= 0.05 hrs
= 3 minutes

questions.text: A train travelling at a speed of 75 mph enters a tunnel 3.5 miles long. The train is 0.25 mile long. How long does it take for the train to pass through the tunnel from the moment the front enters to the moment the rear emerges?

options.detail:
Relative speed
= 63-3
= 60 kmph
Time taken
= 500/(60*5/18)
= 30 seconds

questions.text: How many seconds will a 500 metre long train take to cross a man walking with a speed of 3 km/hr in the direction of the moving train if the speed of the train is 63 km/hr?

options.detail:
4 trains will be needed.

T1, T2 leave Delhi on the first and second nights.
T3, T4 leave Chennai on the first and second nights.

T1 would reach Chennai on the third day morning and hence would leave Chennai on the third night.

T3 would reach Delhi on the third day morning and hence would leave Delhi on the third night.

questions.text: What is the minimum number of trains required between Delhi and Chennai such that every night one train leaves Chennai for Delhi and one train leaves Delhi to Chennai and the train which leaves at night arrives at morning and the journey is of 36hrs?
